column1: Indicator Name: Daytime Summer Surface Temperature
Indicator Description: Surface temperatures in NYC may vary as a function of vegetative land cover which promotes cooling or cover by paved roads sidewalks and buildings which retain heat.

column4: East New York and Starrett City (CD5)
South Crown Heights and Lefferts Gardens (CD9)
South Ozone Park and Howard Beach (CD10)

column3:
How Calculated:

Daytime landsat thermal data on surface July 17 2018 averaged spatially.

column1: NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
More information can be found at: http://nyc.gov/health/tracking
